main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Reno, Nevada on 3rd July 1953. The observed object was a bright, metallic, white circular shape, approximately 30-50 feet in diameter, and made subtle movements in the sky for multiple hours.
interesting points: The object was sighted for approximately 2-3 minutes and appeared to move at a high rate of speed, making a slight whirring sound, and oscillating in an up and down motion.
The witnesses include a professor of geology from the University of Nevada and a person who had spent twelve years in Air Line work as a Meteorologist and Radio Communications.
Efforts were made to report the sighting to authorities including the Air Force, Nevada State Police Headquarters, and the FBI, but received minimal interest or non-commital responses.

The sighting was designated as 'astronomical (Venus)' by Project Blue Book's contract astronomers, despite the detailed observations and efforts made by the witnesses to report the unidentified flying object.
US Air Force Technical Information Sheets and questionnaires were used to collect witness reports and details about the UFO sighting.
witnesses: a professor of geology from the University of Nevada, a person with experience in Air Line work as a Meteorologist and Radio Communications, and their family members
